get.description: Fetches resource vault config.

parameters.name: parameters

get.description: Backup management servers registered to Recovery Services Vault. Returns a pageable list of servers.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter options.

parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: skipToken Filter.

get.description: Returns backup management server registered to Recovery Services Vault.

parameters.name: backupEngineName
parameters.description: Name of the backup management server.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter options.

parameters.name: $skipToken

get.description: Provides the result of the refresh operation triggered by the BeginRefresh operation.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric name associated with the container.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: Operation ID associated with the operation whose result needs to be fetched.

get.description: Lists the containers registered to Recovery Services Vault.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric name associated with the container.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter options.

get.description: Gets details of the specific container registered to your Recovery Services Vault.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Name of the fabric where the container belongs.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: Name of the container whose details need to be fetched.

put.description:
Registers the container with Recovery Services vault.
            This is an asynchronous operation. To track the operation status, use location header to call get latest status of
            the operation.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric name associated with the container.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: Name of the container to be registered.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Request body for operation

delete.description:
Unregisters the given container from your Recovery Services Vault. This is an asynchronous operation. To determine
            whether the backend service has finished processing the request, call Get Container Operation Result API.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Name of the fabric where the container belongs.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: Name of the container which needs to be unregistered from the Recovery Services Vault.

post.summary: Inquires all the protectable item in the given container that can be protected.
post.description: Inquires all the protectable items that are protectable under the given container.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric Name associated with the container.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: Name of the container in which inquiry needs to be triggered.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter options.

get.description:
Provides a pageable list of workload item of a specific container according to the query filter and the pagination
            parameters.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric name associated with the container.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: Name of the container.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter options.

parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: skipToken Filter.

get.description: Fetches the result of any operation on the container.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric name associated with the container.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: Container name whose information should be fetched.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: Operation ID which represents the operation whose result needs to be fetched.

get.description:
Provides the details of the backed up item. This is an asynchronous operation. To know the status of the operation,
            call the GetItemOperationResult API.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric name associated with the backed up item.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: Container name associated with the backed up item.

parameters.name: protectedItemName
parameters.description: Backed up item name whose details are to be fetched.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter options.

put.description:
Enables backup of an item or to modifies the backup policy information of an already backed up item. This is an
            asynchronous operation. To know the status of the operation, call the GetItemOperationResult API.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric name associated with the backup item.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: Container name associated with the backup item.

parameters.name: protectedItemName
parameters.description: Item name to be backed up.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: resource backed up item

delete.description:
Used to disable backup of an item within a container. This is an asynchronous operation. To know the status of the
            request, call the GetItemOperationResult API.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric name associated with the backed up item.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: Container name associated with the backed up item.

parameters.name: protectedItemName
parameters.description: Backed up item to be deleted.

post.description:
Triggers backup for specified backed up item. This is an asynchronous operation. To know the status of the
            operation, call GetProtectedItemOperationResult API.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric name associated with the backup item.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: Container name associated with the backup item.

parameters.name: protectedItemName
parameters.description: Backup item for which backup needs to be triggered.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: resource backup request

get.description: Fetches the result of any operation on the backup item.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric name associated with the backup item.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: Container name associated with the backup item.

parameters.name: protectedItemName
parameters.description: Backup item name whose details are to be fetched.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: OperationID which represents the operation whose result needs to be fetched.

get.description:
Fetches the status of an operation such as triggering a backup, restore. The status can be in progress, completed
            or failed. You can refer to the OperationStatus enum for all the possible states of the operation. Some operations
            create jobs. This method returns the list of jobs associated with the operation.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric name associated with the backup item.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: Container name associated with the backup item.

parameters.name: protectedItemName
parameters.description: Backup item name whose details are to be fetched.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: OperationID represents the operation whose status needs to be fetched.

get.description: Lists the backup copies for the backed up item.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric name associated with the backed up item.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: Container name associated with the backed up item.

parameters.name: protectedItemName
parameters.description: Backed up item whose backup copies are to be fetched.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter options.

get.description:
Provides the information of the backed up data identified using RecoveryPointID. This is an asynchronous operation.
            To know the status of the operation, call the GetProtectedItemOperationResult API.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric name associated with backed up item.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: Container name associated with backed up item.

parameters.name: protectedItemName
parameters.description: Backed up item name whose backup data needs to be fetched.

parameters.name: recoveryPointId
parameters.description: RecoveryPointID represents the backed up data to be fetched.

post.description:
Provisions a script which invokes an iSCSI connection to the backup data. Executing this script opens a file
            explorer displaying all the recoverable files and folders. This is an asynchronous operation. To know the status of
            provisioning, call GetProtectedItemOperationResult API.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric name associated with the backed up items.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: Container name associated with the backed up items.

parameters.name: protectedItemName
parameters.description: Backed up item name whose files/folders are to be restored.

parameters.name: recoveryPointId
parameters.description:
Recovery point ID which represents backed up data. iSCSI connection will be provisioned
            for this backed up data.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: resource ILR request

post.description:
Restores the specified backed up data. This is an asynchronous operation. To know the status of this API call, use
            GetProtectedItemOperationResult API.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric name associated with the backed up items.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: Container name associated with the backed up items.

parameters.name: protectedItemName
parameters.description: Backed up item to be restored.

parameters.name: recoveryPointId
parameters.description: Recovery point ID which represents the backed up data to be restored.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: resource restore request

post.description:
Revokes an iSCSI connection which can be used to download a script. Executing this script opens a file explorer
            displaying all recoverable files and folders. This is an asynchronous operation.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric name associated with the backed up items.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: Container name associated with the backed up items.

parameters.name: protectedItemName
parameters.description: Backed up item name whose files/folders are to be restored.

parameters.name: recoveryPointId
parameters.description:
Recovery point ID which represents backed up data. iSCSI connection will be revoked for
            this backed up data.

post.description:
Discovers all the containers in the subscription that can be backed up to Recovery Services Vault. This is an
            asynchronous operation. To know the status of the operation, call GetRefreshOperationResult API.

parameters.name: fabricName
parameters.description: Fabric name associated the container.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter options.

post.description:
Cancels a job. This is an asynchronous operation. To know the status of the cancellation, call
            GetCancelOperationResult API.

parameters.name: jobName
parameters.description: Name of the job to cancel.

get.description:
Fetches the result of any operation.
            the operation.

parameters.name: jobName
parameters.description: Job name whose operation result has to be fetched.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: OperationID which represents the operation whose result has to be fetched.

get.description:
Provides the status of the delete operations such as deleting backed up item. Once the operation has started, the
            status code in the response would be Accepted. It will continue to be in this state till it reaches completion. On
            successful completion, the status code will be OK. This method expects OperationID as an argument. OperationID is
            part of the Location header of the operation response.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: OperationID which represents the operation.

get.description:
Fetches the status of an operation such as triggering a backup, restore. The status can be in progress, completed
            or failed. You can refer to the OperationStatus enum for all the possible states of an operation. Some operations
            create jobs. This method returns the list of jobs when the operation is complete.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: OperationID which represents the operation.

get.description:
Provides the details of the backup policies associated to Recovery Services Vault. This is an asynchronous
            operation. Status of the operation can be fetched using GetPolicyOperationResult API.

parameters.name: policyName
parameters.description: Backup policy information to be fetched.

put.description:
Creates or modifies a backup policy. This is an asynchronous operation. Status of the operation can be fetched
            using GetPolicyOperationResult API.

parameters.name: policyName
parameters.description: Backup policy to be created.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: resource backup policy

delete.description:
Deletes specified backup policy from your Recovery Services Vault. This is an asynchronous operation. Status of the
            operation can be fetched using GetPolicyOperationResult API.

parameters.name: policyName
parameters.description: Backup policy to be deleted.

get.description: Provides the result of an operation.

parameters.name: policyName
parameters.description: Backup policy name whose operation's result needs to be fetched.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: Operation ID which represents the operation whose result needs to be fetched.

get.description:
Provides the status of the asynchronous operations like backup, restore. The status can be in progress, completed
            or failed. You can refer to the Operation Status enum for all the possible states of an operation. Some operations
            create jobs. This method returns the list of jobs associated with operation.

parameters.name: policyName
parameters.description: Backup policy name whose operation's status needs to be fetched.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: Operation ID which represents an operation whose status needs to be fetched.

get.description:
Provides a pageable list of protectable objects within your subscription according to the query filter and the
            pagination parameters.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter options.

parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: skipToken Filter.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter options.

parameters.description: Vault storage config request

recoveryPointExpiryTimeInUTC.description: Backup copy will expire after the time specified (UTC).

healthStatus.description: backups running status for this backup item.

friendlyName.description: Friendly name of the backup engine.

diskCount.description: Number of disks in the backup engine.

availableDiskSpace.description: Diskspace currently available in the backup engine.

refreshedAt.description: Last refresh time in the backup engine.

azureProtectedInstances.description: Protected instances in the backup engine.

objectType.description: This property will be used as the discriminator for deciding the specific types in the polymorhpic chain of types.

BackupRequestResource.description: Base class for backup request. Workload-specific backup requests are derived from this class.

Mandator suffix that should be added to the name of script that is given for download to user.

extendedInformation.description: Extended information (not returned in List container API calls)

serviceEndpoints.description: Azure Backup Service Endpoints for the container

policyState.description: Indicates consistency of policy object and policy applied to this backup item.

protectionState.description: Backup state of this backup item.

protectedItemId.description: Data Plane Service ID of the protected item.

sourceAssociations.description: Loosely coupled (type, value) associations (example - parent of a protected item)

fabricName.description: Name of this backup item's fabric.

subProtectionPolicy.description: List of sub-protection policies which includes schedule and retention

timeZone.description: TimeZone optional input as string. For example: TimeZone = "Pacific Standard Time".

friendlyName.description: Friendly name of the backup copy.

recoveryPointTime.description: Time at which this backup copy was created.

recoveryPointAdditionalInfo.description: Additional information associated with this backup copy.

expand.description: Specifies if the additional information should be provided for this item.

recoveryPointExpiryTimeInUTC.description: Backup copy will expire after the time specified (UTC).

virtualMachineId.description: Fully qualified ARM url of the virtual machine represented by this Azure IaaS VM container.

virtualMachineVersion.description: Specifies whether the container represents a Classic or an Azure Resource Manager VM.

resourceGroup.description: Resource group name of Recovery Services Vault.

IaasVMILRRegistrationRequest.description: Restore files/folders from a backup copy of IaaS VM.

recoveryPointId.description: ID of the IaaS VM backup copy from where the files/folders have to be restored.

virtualMachineId.description: Fully qualified ARM ID of the virtual machine whose the files / folders have to be restored.

renewExistingRegistration.description: Whether to renew existing registration with the iSCSI server.

virtualMachineId.description: Fully qualified ARM ID of the virtual machine.

IaasVMRecoveryPoint.description: IaaS VM workload specific backup copy.

recoveryPointTime.description: Time at which this backup copy was created.

recoveryPointAdditionalInfo.description: Additional information associated with this backup copy.

sourceVMStorageType.description: Storage type of the VM whose backup copy is created.

isSourceVMEncrypted.description: Identifies whether the VM was encrypted when the backup copy is created.

keyAndSecret.description: Required details for recovering an encrypted VM. Applicable only when IsSourceVMEncrypted is true.

isInstantIlrSessionActive.description: Is the session to recover items from this backup copy still active.

isManagedVirtualMachine.description: Whether VM is with Managed Disks

recoveryPointId.description: ID of the backup copy to be recovered.

sourceResourceId.description: Fully qualified ARM ID of the VM which is being recovered.

targetVirtualMachineId.description:
This is the complete ARM Id of the VM that will be created.
            For e.g. /subscriptions/{subId}/resourcegroups/{rg}/provider/Microsoft.Compute/virtualmachines/{vm}

targetResourceGroupId.description:
This is the ARM Id of the resource group that you want to create for this Virtual machine and other artifacts.
            For e.g. /subscriptions/{subId}/resourcegroups/{rg}

storageAccountId.description: Fully qualified ARM ID of the storage account to which the VM has to be restored.

virtualNetworkId.description:
This is the virtual network Id of the vnet that will be attached to the virtual machine.
            User will be validated for join action permissions in the linked access.

subnetId.description:
Subnet ID, is the subnet ID associated with the to be restored VM. For Classic VMs it would be
            {VnetID}/Subnet/{SubnetName} and, for the Azure Resource Manager VMs it would be ARM resource ID used to represent
            the subnet.

targetDomainNameId.description:
Fully qualified ARM ID of the domain name to be associated to the VM being restored. This applies only to Classic
            Virtual Machines.

region.description: Region in which the virtual machine is restored.

affinityGroup.description: Affinity group associated to VM to be restored. Used only for Classic Compute Virtual Machines.

createNewCloudService.description:
Should a new cloud service be created while restoring the VM. If this is false, VM will be restored to the same
            cloud service as it was at the time of backup.

encryptionDetails.description: Details needed if the VM was encrypted at the time of backup.

objectType.description: This property will be used as the discriminator for deciding the specific types in the polymorhpic chain of types.

InquiryInfo.description: Details about inquired protectable items under a given container.

status.description:
Inquiry Status for this container such as
            InProgress | Failed | Succeeded

errorDetail.description: Error Details if the Status is non-success.

inquiryDetails.description:
Inquiry Details which will have workload specific details.
            For e.g. - For SQL and oracle this will contain different details.

InquiryValidation.description: Validation for inquired protectable items under a given container.

errorDetail.description: Error Detail in case the status is non-success.

InstantItemRecoveryTarget.description: Target details for file / folder restore.

KEKDetails.description: KEK is encryption key for BEK.

keyVaultId.description: Key Vault ID where this Key is stored.

KeyAndSecretDetails.description:
BEK is bitlocker key.
            KEK is encryption key for BEK
            If the VM was encrypted then we will store follwing details :
            1. Secret(BEK) - Url + Backup Data + vaultId.
            2. Key(KEK) - Url + Backup Data + vaultId.
            3. EncryptionMechanism
            BEK and KEK can potentiallty have different vault ids.

kekDetails.description: KEK is encryption key for BEK.

scheduleFrequencyInMins.description: Frequency of the log schedule operation of this policy in minutes.

dailySchedule.description: Daily retention schedule of the protection policy.

weeklySchedule.description: Weekly retention schedule of the protection policy.

monthlySchedule.description: Monthly retention schedule of the protection policy.

yearlySchedule.description: Yearly retention schedule of the protection policy.

MabContainer.description: Container with items backed up using MAB backup engine.

canReRegister.description: Can the container be registered one more time.

protectedItemCount.description: Number of items backed up in this container.

mabContainerHealthDetails.description: Health details on this mab container.

lastRefreshedAt.description: Time stamp when this container was refreshed.

backupItemType.description: Type of backup items associated with this container.

backupItems.description: List of backup items associated with this container.

policyName.description: Backup policy associated with this container.

lastBackupStatus.description: Latest backup status of this container.

friendlyName.description: Friendly name of this backup item.

computerName.description: Name of the computer associated with this backup item.

isScheduledForDeferredDelete.description: Specifies if the item is scheduled for deferred deletion.

extendedInfo.description: Additional information with this backup item.

MabFileFolderProtectedItemExtendedInfo.description: Additional information on the backed up item.

lastRefreshedAt.description: Last time when the agent data synced to service.

recoveryPointCount.description: Number of backup copies associated with the backup item.

retentionScheduleFormatType.description: Retention schedule format type for monthly retention policy.

retentionScheduleDaily.description: Daily retention format for monthly retention policy.

retentionScheduleWeekly.description: Weekly retention format for monthly retention policy.

error.description: Error information related to this operation.

properties.description: Additional information associated with this operation.

OperationStatusError.description: Error information associated with operation status call.

code.description: Error code of the operation failure.

message.description: Error message displayed if the operation failure.

OperationStatusExtendedInfo.description: Base class for additional information of operation status.

objectType.description: This property will be used as the discriminator for deciding the specific types in the polymorhpic chain of types.

jobId.description: ID of the job created for this protected item.

OperationStatusJobsExtendedInfo.description: Operation status extended info for list of jobs.

jobIds.description: IDs of the jobs created for the protected item.

failedJobsError.description: Stores all the failed jobs along with the corresponding error codes.

OperationStatusProvisionILRExtendedInfo.description: Operation status extended info for ILR provision action.

recoveryTarget.description: Target details for file / folder restore.

startTime.description: Start time of the time range for log recovery.

endTime.description: End time of the time range for log recovery.

PreBackupValidation.description: Pre-backup validation for Azure VM Workload provider.

status.description: Status of protectable item, i.e. InProgress,Succeeded,Failed

message.description: Message corresponding to the error code for the protectable item

backupManagementType.description: Type of backup managemenent for the container.

protectableContainerType.description:
Type of the container. The value of this property for
            1. Compute Azure VM is Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines
            2. Classic Compute Azure VM is Microsoft.ClassicCompute/virtualMachines

healthStatus.description: Status of health of the container.

containerId.description: Fabric Id of the container such as ARM Id.

backupManagementType.description: Type of backup managemenent for the backed up item.

workloadType.description: Type of workload this item represents.

sourceResourceId.description: ARM ID of the resource to be backed up.

policyId.description: ID of the backup policy with which this item is backed up.

lastRecoveryPoint.description: Timestamp when the last (latest) backup copy was created for this backup item.

backupSetName.description: Name of the backup set the backup item belongs to

createMode.description: Create mode to indicate recovery of existing soft deleted data source or creation of new data source.

ProtectionContainer.description: Base class for container with backup items. Containers with specific workloads are derived from this class.

backupManagementType.description: Type of backup managemenent for the container.

registrationStatus.description: Status of registration of the container with the Recovery Services Vault.

healthStatus.description: Status of health of the container.

containerType.description:
Type of the container. The value of this property for: 1. Compute Azure VM is Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines 2.
            Classic Compute Azure VM is Microsoft.ClassicCompute/virtualMachines 3. Windows machines (like MAB, DPM etc) is
            Windows 4. Azure SQL instance is AzureSqlContainer. 5. Storage containers is StorageContainer. 6. Azure workload
            Backup is VMAppContainer

ProtectionContainerResource.description: Base class for container with backup items. Containers with specific workloads are derived from this class.

ProtectionPolicy.description: Base class for backup policy. Workload-specific backup policies are derived from this class.

protectedItemsCount.description: Number of items associated with this policy.

backupManagementType.description: This property will be used as the discriminator for deciding the specific types in the polymorhpic chain of types.

ProtectionPolicyResource.description: Base class for backup policy. Workload-specific backup policies are derived from this class.

RecoveryPoint.description: Base class for backup copies. Workload-specific backup copies are derived from this class.

objectType.description: This property will be used as the discriminator for deciding the specific types in the polymorhpic chain of types.

RecoveryPointResource.description: Base class for backup copies. Workload-specific backup copies are derived from this class.

id.description: Resource Id represents the complete path to the resource.

name.description: Resource name associated with the resource.

type.description: Resource type represents the complete path of the form Namespace/ResourceType/ResourceType/...

ResourceList.description: Base for all lists of resources.

nextLink.description: The uri to fetch the next page of resources. Call ListNext() fetches next page of resources.

RestoreFileSpecs.description: Restore file specs like file path, type and target folder path info.

fileSpecType.description: Indicates what the Path variable stands for

targetFolderPath.description: Destination folder path in target FileShare

RestoreRequest.description: Base class for restore request. Workload-specific restore requests are derived from this class.

objectType.description: This property will be used as the discriminator for deciding the specific types in the polymorhpic chain of types.

RestoreRequestResource.description: Base class for restore request. Workload-specific restore requests are derived from this class.

count.description:
Count of duration types. Retention duration is obtained by the counting the duration type Count times.
            For example, when Count = 3 and DurationType = Weeks, retention duration will be three weeks.

durationType.description: Retention duration type of retention policy.

retentionPolicyType.description: This property will be used as the discriminator for deciding the specific types in the polymorhpic chain of types.

schedulePolicyType.description: This property will be used as the discriminator for deciding the specific types in the polymorhpic chain of types.

Settings.description: Common settings field for backup management

timeZone.description: TimeZone optional input as string. For example: TimeZone = "Pacific Standard Time".

isCompression.description:
Workload compression flag. This has been added so that 'isSqlCompression'
            will be deprecated once clients upgrade to consider this flag.

retentionDuration.description: Retention duration of the protection policy.

scheduleRunFrequency.description: Frequency of the schedule operation of this policy.

scheduleRunDays.description: List of days of week this schedule has to be run.

scheduleRunTimes.description: List of times of day this schedule has to be run.

scheduleWeeklyFrequency.description: At every number weeks this schedule has to be run.

SubProtectionPolicy.description: Sub-protection policy which includes schedule and retention

schedulePolicy.description: Backup schedule specified as part of backup policy.

retentionPolicy.description: Retention policy with the details on backup copy retention ranges.

targetResourceId.description: Target file share resource ARM ID

TargetRestoreInfo.description: Details about target workload during restore operation.

overwriteOption.description: Can Overwrite if Target DataBase already exists

containerId.description: Resource Id name of the container in which Target DataBase resides

databaseName.description: Database name InstanceName/DataBaseName for SQL or System/DbName for SAP Hana

daysOfTheWeek.description: List of days of the week.
List of days of week for weekly retention policy.

WorkloadInquiryDetails.description: Details of an inquired protectable item.

type.description: Type of the Workload such as SQL, Oracle etc.

itemCount.description: Contains the protectable item Count inside this Container.

inquiryValidation.description: Inquiry validation such as permissions and other backup validations.

workloadType.description: Type of workload for the backup management

friendlyName.description: Friendly name of the backup item.

protectionState.description: State of the back up item.

friendlyName.description: Friendly name of the backup item.

protectionState.description: State of the back up item.

monthsOfYear.description: List of months of year of yearly retention policy.
